GalPRIME Modules

2D Background Modelling and Subtraction (galprime.backgrounds)

Background estimation and subtraction module.

This module contains all methods available to estimate the backgrounds of cutouts, and to subtract these backgrounds from cutouts or profiles as a means to correct them.

class SourceMask(img, nsigma=3.0, npixels=10, mask=None)[source]

Bases: object

dilated(tophat_size=[3.0], mask=None)[source]

Mask using simple dilation

multiple(filter_fwhm=[3.0], tophat_size=[3.0], mask=None)[source]

Mask repeatedly on different scales

single(filter_fwhm=3.0, tophat_size=5.0, mask=None)[source]

Mask on a single scale

background_2D(img, mask, box_size, interp=None, filter_size=1, exclude_percentile=90)[source]

Run photutils background with SigmaClip and MedianBackground

Parameters

  • img (array_like (np.ndarray)) – The 2D input image

  • mask (array_like (np.ndarray)) – The 2D image mask

  • box_size (int, optional) – The size of the box used in the 2D background. It should be larger than the largest objects in your image but still sufficiently small to capture large-scale structure.

  • filter_size (int, optional) – The window size of the median filter being applied to the background image. A higher filter size will result in more smoothing to the background.

  • exclude_percentile (float, optional) – If the percentage of masked pixels in a box is above the exclude percentile, it is not included in determining the 2D background.

dilate_mask(mask, tophat_size)[source]

Dilate a mask with a tophat kernel.

estimate_background_sigclip(cutout, config=None, nsigma=2, npixels=3, dilate_size=7)[source]

Estimate the background mean, median, and standard deviation of a cutout using sigma-clipped-stats

Catalogue Binning (binning)

Binning methods

This module contains all necessary methods for binning catalogues according to various parameters.

class Bin(objects=None, object_column_names=None, bin_params=None)[source]

Bases: object

Class for a single bin of information :param objects: The catalog rows that belong to the given bin :type bin_param_names: array_like :param object_column_names: The column names when the objects are sorted column-wise instead of row-wise. :type bin_param_names: array_like :param bin_params (arr): The values that define the bounds of the bin. :type bin_param_names: array_like :param bin_param_names (arr): Array of parameter names that the bin was made with. :type bin_param_names: array_like

to_table(filename=None, overwrite=False)[source]

Creates a astropy.table.Table object for the objects and names contained within the bin.

Parameters

  • filename (str, optional) – Filename for saving, defaults to None

  • overwrite (bool, optional) – Overwrite filename to save, defaults to False

Returns

Table of data parameters and associated

bin_catalog(config)[source]

Bin the inputted catalog.

This is a convenience function to get a list of bins based on redshift, star-formation, and mass.

Parameters

config (dict) – Values from input config file or user inputs.

Returns

List of bins that have been binned according to the config settings.

plot_bin_params(b, columns=4, filename=None, dpi=150)[source]

Generate a nice plot of a bin’s structural parameters

Parameters

  • b (Bin) – Input bin

  • columns (int, optional) – Number of columns per row, defaults to 4

  • filename (str, optional) – Output filename, defaults to None If none, plt.show() is run instead

  • dpi (int, optional) – DPI for saved image, defaults to 150

Configuring GalPRIME (config)

Configuration settings methods.

This module contains all methods required to properly set up or read a configuration file for use with TBriDGE.

config_to_file(config, filename='config_out.galprime')[source]

Write a config dict to a file.

Parameters

  • config (dict) – The configuration parameters.

  • filename (str, optional) – The location where the parameters will be written, defaults to config_out.galprime.

default_config_params()[source]

Dumps a dict object containing all default parameters in proper type format.

Returns

Dictionary of config file values

Return type

dict

dump_default_config_file(directory='')[source]

Dumps a default configuration file with all necessary parameters in the directory

Parameters

directory (str, optional) – Directory to write file to, defaults to local directory.

dump_default_config_file_koe(directory='')[source]
load_config_file(filename, verbose_test=False)[source]

Loads in a config file for GalPrime to run

Parameters

  • filename (str) – Filename (can be absolute or relative path, or a URL) to read config file from.

  • verbose_test (bool, optional) – If true, will create a helpful printout of params to ensure that the parameters are loading in properly.

Returns

Configuration file as a dict object.

Return type

dict

Loads in a config file for KOE to run

Args:

filename: Filename (can be absolute or relative path, or a URL) to read config file from.

Returns:

dict: Configuration file as a dict object.

get_angular_size_dist(z, H0=71, WM=0.27)[source]

Return the angular size distance in Megaparsecs. (Stripped down version of Cosmocalc by Ned Wright and Tom Aldcroft (aldcroft@head.cfa.harvard.edu))

Parameters

  • z (float) – The redshift.

  • H0 (float, optional) – The Hubble constant, defaults to 71 km/s/Mpc

  • WM (float, optional) – matter density parameter, defaults to 0.27

get_closest_psf(psfs, ra, dec, ra_key='RA', dec_key='DEC')[source]
get_image_filenames(images_directory)[source]

Retrieves a list of all available filenames for a given directory, and a given band.

Parameters

  • images_directory (str) – The top-level directory from which to get image filenames from.

  • image_band (str, optional) – The image band, defaults to “i”

  • check_band (bool, optional) – Check to make sure the images are of a certain band, defaults to False. WARNING: Optimized for HSC filename format (ex: HSC-I_9813_4c3.fits).

get_wcs(fits_filename)[source]

Finds and returns the WCS for an image. If Primary Header WCS no good, searches each index until a good one is found. If none found, raises a ValueError

Parameters

fits_filename (str) – The filename for the FITS file.

Returns

The WCS object.

Raises

ValueError

1D Surface Brightness Profile Extraction (extraction)

isophote_fitting(data, config=None, centre_method='standard')[source]
Wrapper for the photutils isophote extraction routine. Designed to get the most out of profile

extractions.

Parameters

  • data (numpy.ndarray) – Input data (2D cutout)

  • config (dict, optional) – The configuration file with isophote fitting params. Will use default parameters if nothing is supplied, defaults to None

  • centre_method (str, optional) – Which method to use when finding the centre for initial isophote, defaults to ‘standard’ ‘standard’ Uses the central region of the cutout ‘max’ Uses the location of the brightest pixel. Only use if your cutout is properly masked.

Returns

The photutils isophotelist object containing extraction results.

Return type

photutils.isophote.IsophoteList

Automated Profile Extraction with Koe (koe)

This module contains the methods required to run KOE, which is a tool designed to automatically extract profiles from a directory of images, with a given input catalogue.

koe_pipeline(config)[source]

The entire KOE pipeline configured to work with TBriDGE methods.

process_object(image, image_wcs, object_info, config)[source]

Process a single object, from the whole image to the final profile, for a given location.

Medians and Bootstrapping (medians)

array2D_median(array2D)[source]

Get the median of a 2D array of profiles (used in bootstrap_median())

boostrap_median(table_list, iterations=500, x_step=0.5, plot_dir=None, plot_prefix='')[source]

Generate an Astropy Table object containing the values from bootstrapping of a set of profiles.

Parameters

  • table_list (list(Table())) – A set of tables (outputs from galprime.isophote_fitting, processed using the to_table() method).

  • iterations (int, optional) – The number of bootstrap iterations to run, defaults to 500

  • x_step (float, optional) – The step between samples along the x-axis, defaults to 0.5

  • plot_dir (str, optional) – Directory to generate output plots where if None, no plots are made, defaults to None

  • plot_prefix (str, optional) – Prefix to include in the output plots. This is helpful if you have a bin and want to include which bin the plots are coming from, defaults to “”

Returns

The table of

Return type

astropy Table object

interp_median(xs, interp_list)[source]

Get the median for a list of interp1D object profiles

Parameters

  • xs (array_like) – The x slices to get the median at

  • interp_list (list(scipy.interp1D)) – The list of interp1D objects (individual profiles)

Returns

A 1D interpolation of the median profile.

Return type

scipy.interpolate.interp1D
